intro: Medinilla subauriculata, commonly known as the golden medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Medinilla subauriculata is also valued for its ability to produce edible fruits, which are used in traditional cuisines.
